text:
Hi, in the `transfer_preapproval` contract, there is an item `expiresAt` .
1. What happens when this `transfer_preapproval` expires? 
2. Will it be automatically renewed or one needs to create a new one? 
3. How is the expired contract, archived or be there forever? If not archived, I assume the validator-api would return the one still not expired.
Thanks.

elements.text: Will it be automatically renewed or one needs to create a new one?
How is the expired contract, archived or be there forever? If not archived, I assume the validator-api would return the one still not expired.

text:
> On 3
<https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/0a0bd500df73dbc90874ac394ef14f5818b49fdb/apps/sv/src/main/scala/org/lfdecentralizedtrust/splice/sv/automation/delegatebased/ExpireTransferPreapprovalsTrigger.scala#L53|https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/0a0bd500df73dbc90874ac394ef14f5818[…]utomation/delegatebased/ExpireTransferPreapprovalsTrigger.scala> running on the SV app takes care of calling the expiry choice.

elements.text: running on the SV app takes care of calling the expiry choice.

text:
>  On 2
Renewal happens automatically if the pre-approval lists the validator operator party as the provider: <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/main/apps/validator/src/main/scala/org/lfdecentralizedtrust/splice/validator/automation/RenewTransferPreapprovalTrigger.scala|https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/main/apps/validator/src/main/scala[…]lice/validator/automation/RenewTransferPreapprovalTrigger.scala>

attachments.title: <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/main/apps/validator/src/main/scala/org/lfdecentralizedtrust/splice/validator/automation/RenewTransferPreapprovalTrigger.scala|RenewTransferPreapprovalTrigger.scala>

elements.text: Renewal happens automatically if the pre-approval lists the validator operator party as the provider:

text:
>  On 1
on expiry the deadlines checks on the choices change: <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/0a0bd500df73dbc90874ac394ef14f5818b49fdb/daml/splice-amulet/daml/Splice/AmuletRules.daml#L1470>

No more _Send, but _Expire becomes available

elements.text: on expiry the deadlines checks on the choices change:

text:
<https://docs.sync.global/app_dev/scan_api/scan_openapi.html#get--readyz|https://docs.sync.global/app_dev/scan_api/scan_openapi.html#get--readyz> 

Also works on your validator: 
curl <http://wallet.localhost/api/validator/readyz|http://wallet.localhost/><http://wallet.localhost/api/validator/readyz|api/validator/readyz> 
(Returns nothing, but 200 OK in the response header) 

You can change readyz to livez (same 200 OK)

And also “version” and status”, both of which return JSON you can parse.

text: Go-live depends on adoption by the SVs, so the announcements in this channel and in the validator-operations email list at <https://lists.sync.global> are the best way to know that a new release is ready for adoption.

attachments.text: To edit your profile visit <https://lists.sync.global/g/globalSyncForum/editprofile> *This mailing list provides a general forum for learning about the Global Synchronizer.* Intended for discussions of general interest to: Node operators Application providers Application users of the Global Synchronizer on Canton Network. Anyone with a <http://groups.io|groups.io> account may join this group. New posters are moderated until they post two approved messages. Posts are public, and accessible to Google Search Posts in most sub-groups are also public, and accessible to Google Search NOTE: Detailed discussions of technical documentation should take place via GitHub discussions.

text: <https://fivenorthgroup.slack.com/archives/C08AP9QR7K4/p1753712113312239>

elements.text:
FAILURES IN ONBOARDING NEW VALIDATORS TO DEVNET

Splice 0.4.8 introduced an error in the Canton topology management code that adds an excess (quadratic) increase in topology state entries.

This very large increase in topology state causes the onboarding process to stall for new Validator nodes attempting to onboard to DevNet.

The Splice and Canton teams have identified the root cause and are collaborating to implement a fix.

In the meantime, we suggest that you don't attempt to onboard any new nodes to DevNet until further notice. The Splice and Canton teams will work with the Super Validators to determine how quickly a fix can be rolled out, and we'll announce here as soon as we know.

text:
Looking for advice/best practice on Canton Console

*Context:*
• Currently Canton console in our setup is only available by having direct access to Kubernetes
• This makes it difficult to separate between DevOps & Ops usage (Since operational usage should not involve having access to K8)
• Canton console has functionalities that are sensitive in nature relating to authentication/authorisation (that should not be exposed to ops)
• However Canton console also has useful functionalities to monitor parties & transactions for operations
*Alternative*
• PQS (<https://docs.daml.com/query/pqs-user-guide.html>) seems to fulfil some of the desired use case I mention. Unsure if PQS would be more appropriate than Canton console here
Is there a specific usage pattern that caters to what I described? Also want to validate that the use case I have in mind is valid (and not achievable in some other ways) :pray:
